datasource: Hayward, Richard, 1984. The Arbore Language: A First Investigation Including a Vocabulary. Kuschitische Sprachstudien 2. Hamburg: Helmut Buske Verlag [RH84p]
datasourceNotes: 1.According to RH84pp274-276 some bisyllabic verbs show in the Base stem (only?) a CVCVC~CVCC alternation. There is a set of Base stem  paradigms for an alternating verb 'zer(e)n', but only isolated forms for non-contracting bisyllatic verbs such as '?aman'-'believe' and '?eruč'-'vomit'. TODO: Enter complete paradigms for all 12 prefix-class verbs

Vowels.inventory: i e a o u; ii ee aa oo uu

geodemoTXT: Varieties & subdialects of the Western Omo-Tana language Arbore are spoken near Lake Stefanie.

termclusters.label: abr-morphVerb-Infinitive_me
termclusters.note: RH84pp301ff :: There is a –úm infinitive (token 1) & a –mé infinitive (shape2). The former is the default,and the only one possible with prefix verbs (form is based on 3 m sg). Most,but not all,suffix verbs can take a –mé infinitive.

termclusters.label: abr-morphVerb-PatternClassesPrefix
termclusters.note: RH84appC :: There are 12 pref verbs. A complete list is given in the infinitive paradigm. [Give definitions of pattern classses as in RH84p261!]
terms: Irregular Imperative:sg may pl maaččá. Subj t- n- optionally palatalized
1 sg ʔElɗ, other sg ʔELL, all pl ḳeʔ-. Causative:ʔIssIl-
alt. in 1 sg and imprtv aff

termclusters.label: abr-morphVerb-SuppletivePdgmsSuffix
termclusters.note: RH84p :: Note also reference to '26 sufix verbs showing some sort of irregularity' and noted in the lexicon. (Hayward1984a p. 298)
terms: suppletive has full pdgm as ‘run away’
lex has full pdgm with meaning ‘go to’
suppletive has full pdgm as ‘be finished, exhausted’
suppletive has full pdgm as ‘look at’

termclusters.label: abr-morphVerb-TamSuffix
termclusters.note: RH84p :: With the exception of sg imprtv of most verbs all verbf orms terminate in a vowel. (pref and suff largely identical) Hayward1984b p. 255
terms: in free variation with –e for mid1/2/3/4

termclusters.label: abr-morphVerb-VRadicalExt
termclusters.note: RH84p :: The extended stem passive verbs are vary rare indeed in Arbore (Hayward1984a p. 304). Place is taken by Impersonal Construction (= 3 pl verb form in sentence with –na enclitic,pp. 304-308).[NB: 'lexeme' here is already a part of 'token'; need to have separate token]
